sentences.en: "Monopoly" is one of the best-selling games of all time.
sentences.cn: “大富翁”是有史以来最畅销的游戏之一。

sentences.en: A careful distinction was drawn between bigness and monopoly.
sentences.cn: 就这样,在大公司和垄断企业之间作出了谨慎的区别.

sentences.en: A good education should not be the monopoly of the rich.
sentences.cn: 良好的教育不应该成为富人的专利。

sentences.en: An economic life is a blend of competitive and monopoly elements.
sentences.cn: 一切经济生活都是竞争生活与垄断成分的混合物.

sentences.en: During each war the monopoly capitalists amassed fabulous wealth.
sentences.cn: 每次战争垄断资本家们都大发横财.

sentences.en: Had he succeeded, he would have acquired a monopoly.
sentences.cn: 要是他当时成功了，他就会取得垄断地位。

sentences.en: In every case, competitive papers were superior to monopoly ones.
sentences.cn: 总而言之, 互相竞争的报纸都优于垄断的报纸.

sentences.en: In the past central government had a monopoly on television broadcasting.
sentences.cn: 过去，中央政府对电视节目播放实行垄断。

sentences.en: Inflation was so high that the notes were like Monopoly money.
sentences.cn: 通货膨胀严重，货币变得跟“大富翁”游戏钞票无异。

sentences.en: Mass advertising steadily destroyed competitive dailies; monopoly became the norm.
sentences.cn: 大宗广告不断地摧毁竞争日报; 垄断成为普遍现象.

sentences.en: Others say that the problem is monopoly, not bigness.
sentences.cn: 有人则认为问题在于垄断, 而不在于规模大.

sentences.en: Pricing decisions made in a collusive atmosphere come close to monopoly pricing.
sentences.cn: 在勾结的情况下制定的价格,接近于垄断价格.

sentences.en: Scientific achievement is not a male monopoly.
sentences.cn: 科学上的成就不是男人的专利。

sentences.en: The exporting country is unlikely to have much monopoly power.
sentences.cn: 出口国未必具有很大的垄断力量.

sentences.en: The monopoly process is clear when one paper pulls ahead decisively.
sentences.cn: 当一家报纸明显领先时,垄断过程是一清二楚的.

sentences.en: The most serious deviation from the perfect competition comes from monopoly elements.
sentences.cn: 最严重的对完全竞争的背离来源于垄断成份.

sentences.en: Women do not have a monopoly on feelings of betrayal.
sentences.cn: 被出卖的感觉并非只有女性才有。

words.tran_cn: 垄断的；独占性的；专利的
[贸易] 买主独家垄断，买主垄断
垄断；独占；拥有…的专卖权

trans.tran_cn: 垄断，专卖，垄断者，专利品
trans.tran_en: if a company or government has a monopoly of a business or political activity, it has complete control of it so that other organizations cannot compete with it
